snippet: A City Council hearing discussing bills aimed at police reform featured arguments among council members and Michael Best, a counselor to Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg.
abstract: New York City Council hearing centered largely on the New York Police Dept's controversial stop-and-frisk practices, erupts into a series of outbursts and sharp exchanges; hearing before the Public Safety Committee includes testimony on four bills aimed at police reform, and most of the negative comments are directed at attorney who testified against the bills on behalf of Mayor Michael R Bloomberg and the Police Dept.
lead_paragraph: A City Council hearing discussing bills aimed at police reform featured arguments among council members and Michael Best, a counselor to Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg.

headline.seo: Sharp Exchanges at City Council Hearing on Stop-and-Frisk Tactic
headline.main: Sharp Words at Hearing Over Tactics of the Police
